content:
Diagnosis:		Papillary thyroid carcinoma

Management:		Total thyroidectomy March 2023
		Radioactive iodine ablation May 2023

Histology:		Multifocal papillary thyroid carcinoma, largest focus 0.8mm
		BRAF V600E mutation positive
		pT1a(m)N0M0

Current Situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She remains well with no concerning symptoms. Her TSH is well-controlled on Levothyroxine 125mcg daily at 0.3 mU/L. Thyroglobulin remains undetectable (<0.1 μg/L) with negative thyroglobulin antibodies. Neck examination shows well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no palpable abnormalities. She will continue current dose of Levothyroxine and we will see her in 6 months with repeat thyroglobulin measurement and neck ultrasound as per protocol.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Multifocal papillary thyroid carcinoma, largest focus 0.8mm

cancer_timeline.value: Thyroglobulin undetectable (<0.1 μg/L) with negative thyroglobulin antibodies

patient_facts.value: Well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no palpable abnormalities
TSH well-controlled at 0.3 mU/L on Levothyroxine 125mcg daily

status_updates.value: Early stage papillary thyroid cancer post thyroidectomy and radioiodine. No evidence of disease on biochemical monitoring.
Repeat thyroglobulin measurement and neck ultrasound in 6 months
